line.en: 'Hmmm...'
Kotori groans as she turns the pages of the book,\nwhich is all written in English.
'Do you understand it?'
'I kind of understand it, but...'
'I wonder if Hibari will come back soon... If she\ndoes, I can get her to translate it for me...'
Kotori is reading a foreign book about Morning\nGlory and other similar phenomena.
There are few records of such things occurring in\nKazegaura, so it looks like she came across this\nwhile looking for something similar.
'It would be great if there were some articles\nabout phenomena that have occurred in Kazegaura.'
'Not much we can do about that. Besides, it's so\nrare that it only occurs once in a matter of\ndecades.'
It seems that when it happened 26 years ago, it\nwas very sudden, and was shown on TV and in\nnewspapers as a rare phenomenon.
If the photo that the Soaring Club had taken had\nbeen circulated, then the reaction to it would\nhave been quite different.
They didn't have the Internet like we have now,\nso we've only been able to find articles and\nrecords from the time in the library.
But we only know a little about this phenomenon.
'It looks like the passage of clouds is at least\nseveral dozen kilometers long.'
said Kotori, as she showed me the maps that she\nhad made herself. The size was drawn based on\nwitness testimonies.
It was pretty long. It went diagonally across the\nlake, and then just kept going and going.
'It appears just before dawn, and after the sun\nrises, it disappears after a short while.'
'How long does it last?'
'I dunno... Maybe about two or three hours at the\nmost.'
'There is a strong vertical draft around the\nclouds, so if we can ride those, we should be\nable to pass through it in the glider.'
'That's how the old members of the club took the\nphoto.'
'I see...'
When the water vapor becomes a vertical draft\nand, rises up into the sky, the colder air cools\nit down, creating clouds.
There is a strong connection between clouds and\nvertical drafts.
'We don't know when it will occur, so there's no\nway to prepare for it.'
There are only ten days left of the summer\nholiday.
The countdown to Amane quitting the school has\nbegun.
Before then, we have to pass through the passage\nof clouds.
No matter how good a glider we make, or whether\nwe learn to pilot it perfectly, if the Morning\nGlory doesn't occur, we can't do anything.
'...So that's how it is?'
Ageha, who is working on something by herself,\nwipes the sweat from her brow, and takes a\nbreather.
'What have you been doing?'
'Making a cockpit.'
She had attached pedals and a stick that was like\na yoke to a chair.
Calling it a cockpit is slightly lame though.
'Hmm... What's with that look on your face? This\nisn't just a toy, you know.'
Ageha took a cable that extended from her poor\nexcuse for a mock cockpit, and plugged it into\nthe computer.
Kotori, who seems intrigued, leans over.
'Turn on the simulator.'
I turn it on, as she says.
Ageha sits down in the mock cockpit, and operates\nthe yoke.
Then...
'It moved!'
'And the rudder pedals are... awesome!'
'Could it be...'
'It's a cockpit for the simulator.'
Operating the pedals and yoke attached to the\nchair moves the aircraft shown on the monitor.
It felt like magic.
'With this, you get a feeling closer to\ncontrolling the real thing, you know?'
Ageha moves out of the way. I sit down to try it.
'Whoa!! This is great, it really moves!'
'How did you do this!?'
'Something like this is easy! We've got time to\nspare, so I thought I'd try making it.'
'Amane, if you like, you could try it out too.'
Ageha calls out to her, and Amane, who is sitting\nin front of the drawing board, lifts her head up.
'Did you say something?'
'Amane, come over here! If you practice with\nthis, you can improve too!'
Amane comes over, and takes a good look at the\ncockpit that Ageha had made.
'Isn't it amazing? It's great that Ageha can make\nsomething like this!'
'No, not really. It's nothing special...'
'Go ahead, Amane.'
'Let's see now... Oh... you're right, this really\nwill be good to practice with.'
'While muttering 'I should've made it like this\nfrom the beginning', she operates the simulator\nfor a while.
'We could do some practice with this, while we\nwait for the winch to be repaired.'
'Ageha, you rock!'
Why is Kotori the one who is happiest about this?
With the winch broken, club activities were\ngrinded to a halt. We couldn't just stand around,\nwaiting for time to pass.
That's why everyone's been looking for something\nto do.
The feeling that we're making even the slightest\nprogress, lifted everyone's spirits.
'Oh... This is really well made. Sitting like\nthis really enhances the realism...'
Amane is trembling.
'...Even though it's just a simulator, it's still\nscary.'
'This will help you get used to it, so this kills\ntwo birds with one stone.'
I step back a little, to allow Amane into her\nseat. While listening to them all talking, I\nhappen to take a glance at the drawing board.
When she has spare time, Amane is always at the\ndrawing board.
Some plans have been drawn here.
But the aircraft has already been completed.
Even so, I wondered what it was that she had been\ndrawing.
'(It's a glider... the shape of the wings is\ndifferent??)'
The main wings were a bit further forward in\nrelation to the fuselage.
The outline was strange and quite different to\nthe airplanes I know.
'As always, you look like you've got time on your\nhands.'
As I notice this voice come out of the blue, I\nrealize that at some point Tobioka had come into\nthe garage.
Everyone stops talking, and starts acting warily\nof him.
'It would appear that you are playing video\ngames. Are these the activities of the Soaring\nClub?'
Seeing Tobioka appearing suddenly, and making\nsnide comments. Kotori looks like she's about to\nsnap at him.
'(Don't do it, Kotori!)'
'(Ugh... Alright, I won't!)'
'Can we help you?'
'It looks like Yamanobe-sensei has a 'hands-off'\napproach with you, so I came here, in his place,\nto come and see you.'
Yamanobe-sensei is our advisor but he hardly ever\nshows his face here.
That could be because of the pressure from\nTobioka.
If he were to be actively involved with the club,\nhe would become a target for Mr. Tobioka.
'Himegi, did you quit the Robotics Club so that\nyou could play around here? I had such high hopes\nfor you.'
'We're not playing around.'
Ageha retorts sharply, without any fear of\nTobioka.
He frowns in frustration.
'You will come to regret choosing this club.'
'I will work hard to prevent that.'
Really, she looks like she wants to say 'I don't\nneed your opinion, so get outta here! Bleugh!'.\nIt seems like she's putting up with it for now.
'Mochizuki, it would appear that you have flown\nagain.'
'Yes, we did a test flight. If we don't do proper\nclub activities, the student council will get\nangry.'
'At that time, it seems like the winch broke,\ndoesn't it?'
'(How does he know about that?)'
'(Could it be that Yamanobe-sensei informed him\nof that...?)'
As a safety precaution, we tell Mr. Yamanobe\neverything that we'll be doing.
'Are you trying to have another accident?'
'This time, if someone gets injured again, the\nclub's status will be repealed.'
'...having said that, it's going to happen in ten\ndays anyway.'
'You will leave at the end of the summer holiday.\nI ask you not to cause any problems before then.'
'...Very well.'
We left it at that, and Tobioka left the garage.
'What is up with that guy? He really pisses me\noff!'
'He really is just a nasty old man... Quitting\nthe Robotics Club was the right choice.'
'Hey, Amane. That accident that he talking\nabout... was that you?'
'Hmm? Yeah, I know. We have to make sure there\nare no accidents.'
'No, I don't mean that...'
'I'm hungry. Let's go and get something to eat.'
Amane pulls an unnatural smile, then stands up\nand leaves the garage.
'What was that about?'
'I'm not sure...'
'Hey, what was that stuff about the accident?'
'I don't know. But...'
'It looks like to Amane, it's something in the\npast that she doesn't wanna talk about.'
As I say that, the other two both have a grave\nlook on their faces.
Nighttime.
I get out of the bath. It's about time to go to\nbed.
'Amane didn't seem herself today...'
Even at dinner time, she didn't eat much.
Ever since Tobioka mentioned the accident.
What happened?
Everybody was worried about it, but it didn't\nseem like we could ask her about it.
I walk along the hallway while thinking of that,\nand then Amane came down from the second floor.
'Is Kotori about?'
'She's in her room, I think.'
'Right. Thanks.'
Amane knocks on Kotori's door.
'Amane?'
Kotori pokes her head out from her room, and is\nsurprised to see Amane there.
This is probably the first time she's gone to see\nher in her room like this.
'Can I talk to you...?'
'Sure... You wanna come in?'
'OK.'
Kotori invited her in, then Amane went inside the\nroom.
Kotori went to close the door, then noticed I was\nthere.
She looked at me like 'What should I do? Come\nover here!' but there's no way I could go in\nthere.
Eventually, she closed the door.
'Quaaack!'
'...What's the matter, Amane?'
'It's been such a long time...'
'... This used to be Isuka's room. Isn't that\nright, Hat?'
'Quack!'
'In those days, I would often come here to hang\nout. I helped make the duck door for Hat.'
'Oh, really...? (That must be why it looks so\nshoddy...)'
'It hasn't changed much.'
'...I don't have that many things. If there's too\nmuch mess, it'll just get in the way.'
'Did you come to look at the room...?'
'Oh, that's right. I thought I would return\nthis.'
'...This is Isuka's flight log, isn't it?'
'What do you mean 'return' it?'
'This is yours now, isn't it, Kotori?'
'No, I just found it. This is...'
'It's not mine either.'
'But you're the one who should have it. Isuka\nwas... your best friend, right?'
'Isuka didn't leave it here because I was\nsupposed to see it.'
'If that were the case, it could've been given to\nme directly, or left in the garage.'
'I guess so...'
'It was in this room, wasn't it?'
'It was wedged between the shelves. Like it was\nhidden.'
'...I think that you should have it. That must be\nwhat Isuka was thinking.'
'If that's alright with you, Amane...'
'I want you to have it too.'
'OK, I understand...'
'Ha ha, because of coming here, I was able to\nmeet Hat again.'
'Quack!'
'It's been a really fun summer, hasn't it?'
'Amane...'
'It's not over yet.'
'Yes. But...'
'The Morning Glory will come! It will definitely\nhappen!'
'When you say it like that, Kotori, it feels like\nit really will.'
'It will!'
'Well then, I'm off to bed. Goodnight, Kotori.\nGoodnight, Hat.'
'...Goodnight.'
'Quackkkkk'
'...So it's like that, huh?'

The corner of the garage. In a blind spot which
couldn't be seen from the drawing board, in the
shadow of the glider, we were whispering to each
other.
'So, Amane gave the flight log back?'
'Yeah...'
Kotori had told us the details about what had\nhappened in her room last night.
'Seems pretty meaningful...'
'Isn't it? That's why I don't know what to do.'
'...She must be 'getting her affairs in order'.\nIt's getting close to the day that she leaves.'
'Stop it, don't say such sad things like that!'
'It's not like I want to say it. But, there's\nnothing we can do.'
Usually, even if you quit a club, you still carry\non coming to school.
However, in Amane's case, she's already gained\nenough credits, so as long as she doesn't fail\nany of her exams, she'll be able to graduate.
As she said before, once she leaves, she'll go\nback home to help her father with his work.
She probably won't come to school anymore.
When we think about it, we all start to feel\nreally down.
Because of Amane giving Isuka's flight log back\nto Kotori last night, we became strongly aware of\nthe situation.
'...This is mostly a diary, isn't it?'
'Isuka doesn't seem to know much about building\ngliders. In actuality, Amane is the one who made\nit.'
According to the diary, it seems that Isuka was\nthe pilot.
Amane made it, and Isuka flew it. It looks like\nthose were their roles.
I remember when we first joined the club. Amane\nhad said that there was no pilot.
That must've been what she was talking about.
In the log, were all the details of the\nproduction process.
Rather than being a flight log, it was more like\na production log. So, I wondered why Isuka called\nit a 'flight log.
But, it seems that Isuka wasn't a particularly\ndiligent writer. There were numerous days where\nnothing was written.
There were a lot of things that wouldn't mean\nanything if someone else were to read it.
For example:
'It was pointless talking to her about that\nthing. She doesn't know anything about what it's\nlike to be young!'
and so on.
The only ones who would understand was the person\nwho wrote it and 'her', most likely Amane.
'...I guess this must be important to Amane.'
'That's why she gave it back to me. But, she said\nthat she wanted me to have it.'
'Why is that...? Is it because I'm the one who\nfound it?'
'She might think of it as something you've\ninherited.'
'Inherited...? What do mean?'
'Isuka's dreams.'
'You came to the Soaring Club because you found\nit, didn't you?'
'Yeah.'
'So, don't you think that maybe Isuka brought you\nhere?'
'I see. To Amane, it looks like Isuka's dreams\nare what brought Kotori to this place.'
Isuka's dreams, of longing for the sky, are\nrevealed here in the flight log.
If those dreams are what moved Kotori, it could\nbe said that she had inherited them.
'Oh... maybe you're right.'
'Try to remember. In the beginning, when we were\ntalking about getting new members, Amane wasn't\nvery positive about it.'
'But, her attitude completely changed when you\nbrought her that photo and the flight log, didn't\nit?'
'Oh yeah, that's right.'
'I don't know what was going on then but to\nAmane, it must have seemed like something\ndestined to happen.'
Kotori, who feels a heavy sense of\nresponsibility, makes a serious face as she goes\ninto deep thought.
'Anyway, there was something I had on my mind...'
Ageha flicked through the flight log.
'Ah, here it is.'
...At some point, I won't be able to stay here.
was written there.

It looks like it doesn't have much of a
connection to the context of what's written
before and after. It just appears suddenly and
seems kind of out of place.
'What is this?'
'Also, the same kind of thing appears several\ntimes.'
'Is this about quitting school?'
Upon reading more, it doesn't really say why they\nhad to leave.
'...What happened? Is this something to do with\nthe 'accident'?'
'So, did the reason that Isuka leave have some\nconnection with the accident?'
'I don't know...'
'But, Amane wanting to fly through the Morning\nGlory is for Isuka's sake, right?'
Kotori opens a page in the log.
This is what was written there:
'I still can't forget the emotion I felt when I\nsaw that photo.
That such a beautiful view could be from above\nthe town where we live, in the sky that is always\nthere, stretching out far and wide.
Even so, she didn't seem so surprised, and looked\nlike she wasn't moved at all.
That's why I thought 'I'm going to take you\nthere, for sure'!
When she sees the real thing, even Amane would be\nbrought to tears. She'll definitely be moved by\nit, no doubt about it!!'
This is the page where the photo was placed\ninside the book.
'You might be right.'
There's no way that Amane, who is scared of\nheights, would want to fly above the clouds.
Despite that, she caused problems for her father,\nand continued to stay at school, becoming the\nSuper Repeat Student.
She must have wanted to see the view that Isuka\nwanted to show her.
'...Amane.'
'What is it?'
'Aaaaaaaaaaah!!!'
Kotori, jumping up out of her wheelchair, hastily\nhid the flight log behind her back.
'What have you guys been whispering about.'
'N-...Nothing, Amane!'
'That's right, we were just talking amongst\nourselves... Ah ha ha...'
Amane looks at me.
'Like she says, just talking amongst ourselves.'
As I answer, Amane pouts.
'Really? So this doesn't include me, then...?'
Aw crap, she's really upset!
Since she was concentrating on the drawing board,\nI thought she wouldn't notice what we were doing!
'No, that's not it! It's... umm... your farewell\nparty! We were planning it!'
'Farewell party?'
'Because you're leaving this year, that's why!'
'That's why...'
Kotori's voice fades away.
Although she used it as an excuse in the heat of\nthe moment, we don't really want to talk about\nAmane leaving.
In the place of Kotori, who had fallen silent, I\ncontinue the story.
'We were planning it in secret because we thought\nwe might surprise you. We're going to prepare all\nyour favorite things.'
'Yes, yes, that's right.'
'...I see. Then I'm sorry.'
'A farewell party? Sounds like fun?'
It seemed that she believed us, and then she\nreturned to her position in front of the drawing\nboard.
'Phew...'
'But, we actually have to do it now.'
'That's fine, let's have a farewell party.'
'...I'm not happy about it, but I want to throw a\nparty.'
I nod in agreement with Kotori.
It's not that I want to say goodbye to Amane.
However, if that's the way it is, I want to give\nher a proper send-off.
'Is this the only thing you need?'
'Umm... It looks like I'm running out of lead for\nmy mechanical pencil, so I'll buy some of that\ntoo.'
I follow Amane into the stationery store.
Today, I've gone shopping with Amane. I'm what\nyou might call a 'bag carrier'.
Even so, going out with Amane, just the two of\nus, could be called one of the perks of the job.
'OK, we haven't forgotten anything, have we?'
'Nope, shall we head back?'
'Thanks for today. Because of you, I was able to\nbuy lots of things.'
'No, it's no problem at all.'
Amane bought paper and equipment for drawing, and\nalso some other tools, for what purpose, I don't\nknow.
The amount and the weight would be too much for\nAmane to carry by herself.
'But why did you suddenly decide to come with me\non my shopping trip?'
'W-... Well... I thought it might be tough to do\nit by yourself!'
Today, I have been entrusted with a secret\nmission.
While the others prepare for the farewell party,\nI have to buy them some time!

A few days ago, it was quickly decided that we
would hold a farewell party. But, in order to
surprise Amane even just a little, we planned to
keep,
at the very least, the day and time of the party\na secret.
'Right now, Kotori and the others should be\nproceeding with the preparations at the\ndormitory.'
(They should be alright with that...)
'They had called for some help, so they told me\nnot to worry.'
Huh? Amane, where are you going?
'I'm going to take these shopping bags back. To\nFlying Fish Manor.'
'Huh? Why!? Aren't you going to put them in the\ngarage!?'
'Nope. I bought these so that I could do some\nwork at the dormitory.'
Really!?
That must be why she's buying large amounts of\nthe same things that she has on her desk in the\ngarage.
'What's wrong? Aren't you coming back?'
'Ah... Well, umm...'
This is bad. If she goes back to the dormitory\nlike this, they'll be caught in the middle of the\npreparations.
'W-Why don't we go for a little stroll?'
'...Sure, I don't mind.'
'What's this all of a sudden?', her face seemed\nto say. But, she agreed to it.
'OK, let's go! As far as possible!'
As far as possible...Following that idea, I chose\nthe course for the stroll.
If we take a detour past the lake along the\npromenade...
Then I noticed that we were walking up a gentle\nslope.
'Oh... This is wonderful.'
As though she was impressed by the sight of\nwindmills lined up along the gently sloping hill,\nAmane let out a sigh.
'Is this the first time you've seen them?'
'It's my first time seeing them from the ground.\nI've only ever seen them from the sky, after\ncrossing the lake.'
Not many people would have seen this place from\nthe air.
I was one of those few people. I feel quite proud\nof that.
'This is a research facility for natural energy,\nisn't it?'
'When I first came to Keifuu Academy, it was\nstill under construction...'
'It was when I had moved away from here.'
I see, at that time, Amane was already a student\nof Keifuu Academy.
'You were in the Robotics Club during your first\nyear. After that, you joined the Soaring Club,\ndidn't you?'
'Yeah, that's right. Well, rather than joining\nit, it would be more correct to say that I made\nit.'
'Together with Isuka... is that right?'
For a moment, Amane looks at me in a mysterious\nway, then nods.
She must find it strange to hear us using Isuka's\nname.
'I was invited by Isuka. She found the photo and\nthe garage, and said 'Let's make a Soaring\nClub'.'
'I wish I could've seen it.'
'What's that?'
'You at that time.'
Amane at the same age as Kotori and Ageha.
Amane looks at her own body again.
'I don't think I've changed much since then.'
Her boobs must have been just as big back then,\ntoo. Kotori would be jealous if she heard that.
Her looks aside, I can't imagine Amane Mochizuki\nas an innocent young girl.
Her height might not have changed much since the\ntime she joined the Robot Club.
'What did you do in the club back then?'
'That's also not that much different to now.\nMaking gliders and flying.'

'Back then, I wasn't really interested in
gliders. It's just that Isuka said that she
wanted to go to the place in the photo. So, it
felt like I was helping her.'
'Is it different now?'
'Aerospace engineering isn't my specialist field.\nBut, I've discovered many interesting things as a\nresult of my research.'
'Also... Doing something with you all... Kotori,\nAgeha, and you, is fun.'
'Do you remember when we completed the main\nwings?'
'Yes, of course.'
'At that time, I was so happy. Everyone's\nefforts... or should I say their feelings...?'
'Uh... I can't really explain but... I feel like\nit had all taken shape.'
'That's why even though I'm scared of flying, the\ntest flight was fun.'
'Amane...'
Without realizing, I feel taken aback.
I usually never know what she's thinking, but now\nI knew that she felt the same way I did back\nthen.
'It probably doesn't matter what it is. As long\nas it's something that we can all get stuck into\ntogether.'
That just happened to be the glider.
The rest of us could probably say the same thing.
'I always wanted to know. The reason why Isuka\nwas so obsessed with it.'
says Amane, as she looks into the distant view on\nthe other side of the lake.
'If I can fly to the passage of clouds, maybe\nI'll understand it.'
'So that's why it's your goal.'
In that place. Even if she's all alone.
Maybe even now, Amane isn't really that into\nmaking gliders.
The thing that she's chasing after, is not the\nsky, but Isuka.
'Where is Isuka now...?'
The question that I had been on the verge of\nasking before, but refrained from, just slipped\nout.
Amane looks at the windmills turning slowly in\nthe wind.
'Well, I don't know. I don't know where she\nwent.'
Amane was smiling.
Not like she was sad or lonely, but like she had\ngiven up.
I regretted asking such an unnecessary question.
Not knowing what to say next, I look up at the\nwindmills with her.
Every time I see them, it's such a tranquil\nscene. It feels as if living life rushing around,\nliving according to time, is so silly.
'By the way, it's pretty hot . The solar panels\nmust work really well here.'
'Yeah.'
Other than the windmills, there are also solar\npanels to generate electricity.
In the direct sun of the middle of summer, they\nmust be working like crazy right now.
'Shall we head back?'
'Huh? Ah... well... what shall we do? Maybe we\nshould stay for a little longer...'
I check the time on my cell phone and it's still\na bit too early.
'What? But it's hot. See, look how much I'm\nsweating.'
she says as she pulls her sweaty clothes away\nfrom her chest.
That's what Ageha said once. That is the area\nthat gets the most sweaty.
'OK, let's go to the convenience store! I'll buy\nyou an ice cream!'
'An ice cream? Sounds good!'
Looking like she was about to start drooling,\nAmane immediately started walking.
I go after her, carrying the bags.
'I'd like the strawberry one. It's sweet, a\nlittle sour and really delicious.'
'Go ahead, have whichever one you'd like.'
In order to buy them some time, it looks like\nI'll need to get her to eat about two or three\nice creams.
We're going to be eating later, but that\nshouldn't be a problem for Amane.
'We're back!'
Going into the entranceway, Amane is surprised by\nthe sound of a cracker going off.
Seeing Kotori and Ageha there, she said
'...Is today my birthday?'
'No... Don't you even know your own birthday?'
'C'mon, come inside.'
'S-...Sure'

With a big question mark on her face, Amane is
brought into the dining hall. Without hesitation,
she showed her amazement when she saw the
spectacle awaiting her inside.
I follow her inside. I also let out a little\ngasp.
There, the dining table was overflowing with\nfood.
'This is incredible, there's so much\ndelicious-looking food!'
'Eh heh heh! Seems like you like it!'
'The first part is a success.'
Kotori and Ageha smile at each other.
'Amane, you've been working hard for so long.'
'Have you forgotten? We said we were going to\nhave a farewell party for you.'
It seems that she really had forgotten, and said\n'Oh yeah...', and nodded when she finally\nremembered.
'I thought that I should forget about it, so I\ndid my best.'

If you try your best to forget something,
wouldn't that just make the memory more vivid?
That's not what Amane's like though. She's not
ordinary.

'Sorry Amane. We didn't want you to see the
preparations for the party. That's why I've been
talking you to all those different places, all
day...'
'That's a nice perk of the job, isn't it? Going\non a date with Amane?'
'H-...Hey, that's not what this is about!'
'Was that a date?'
'No, I just said...'
'That was my first time. So that's what a date is\nlike -- that's another memory that I made before\nleaving.'
'See? She seems happy about it!'
'Ah... yeah.'
'You're blushing! That's so creepy...'
'Sh-...Shut up, will ya? More importantly, you\nguys have done a great job getting all this food\nready.'
By the looks of it, it's a western course.\nThere's Italian and French, but I'm not familiar\nenough with the cuisine to give particular names.
However, there're also things like roast beef and\nchicken, that have been cooked in the oven. So,\nit's a lot like real restaurant food.
'Hibari helped us!'
As Kotori spoiled the surprise slightly, Hibari,\nwho couldn't wait any longer, came into the\ndining hall.
'Good evening, Amane.'
'Good evening,'
'Kotori asked me to come and help out.'
'Oh, I see. So that's why...'
'I'll tell you this, Ageha and I really did help,\ndidn't we?'
'Yes, we did!'
Then, after Hibari, An-chan came in.
We invited him to surprise Amane.
'Amane, congratulations on retiring from the\nclub.'
'Tatsuya... Thank you.'
'It's nice that we could come too...'
'That's fine, isn't it? We helped cut the grass\ntoo.'
Hotaru and Masatsugu are here too.
Like Masatsugu says, they did help out. At times\nlike this, the more the merrier.
'When I heard you were having a party, I just\ncouldn't stay away!'
'Kanako! I thought you went back home!?'
'They kicked me out!'
She must've been wandering around in her\nunderwear again...
But, we can't leave her out of the party. She\nhelped out too.
'Wow, it's so lively.'
It's like she's talking about someone else's\nparty.
'You're the guest of honor, Amane!'
'That's right. Today is your farewell party.'
'Oh yeah. Thanks everyone.'
'Alright, tonight we'll drink and sing, and party\nall night!'
'Yeah!'
'...Don't go too crazy. This building's old and\nfalling apart, you know!'
'Munch, munch, yum, yum... It's delicious!'
'She's the same as always...'
'I can't tell you how disappointed I am to see\nthat...'
Everyone sighs when they see the way that Amane\neats. It totally ruins the effect of her good\nlooks.
'Hmm? What's wrong, you guys?'
'Oh, nothing.'
'We're just glad you like the food!'
'Yeah, it's really tasty! This is great, today's\nfood is so extravagant.'
'That's because Hibari helped us out.'
'Well, she's Kotori's believed senpai. We can't\nhold back when it comes to the food!'
Hibari emphasizes the point.
She's a good person, but when it comes to Kotori,\nshe gets a scary look in her eyes.
'This chicken is delicious... munch, munch.'
She wolfs down the grilled herb chicken with a\ncomplete lack of manners.
I felt a little sad to think that I would no\nlonger be able to see the way she eats so\nexcitedly.
'So, Amane's finally leaving, huh? Of course, I\nwas surprised to see that she was still\ncontinuing with it in the first place.'
'Munch, munch... It's caused a lot of problems\nfor my dad. From now on, I have to show more\nloyalty to him.'
'I didn't expect to hear you talking about\nshowing loyalty to your father.'
'Hey, An-chan, were you one of the members who\nhelped revive the Soaring Club?'
'Me? No, I wasn't. I was invited later.'
'By Amane?'
'I can't remember...'
'Tatsuya was invited by Isuka.'
'When he saw the parts that I had made, he said\n'This'll never do'.'
'...I don't really know what he meant by that\nthough.'
Amane didn't understand but we got it straight\naway.
'And that's when he asked An-chan?'
'An-chan's been helping out at the factory for a\nlong time, Those kind of processing techniques\nare his forte.'
'Hmm... that could be another reason...'
'Another reason?'
'... Oh no, Isuka told me not to tell anyone\nabout that. That was a close one.'
It seems that there's some deep meaning in what\nshe said.

If it was any ordinary person cutting themselves
off like that, it would be like they were waiting
for us to say 'So, tell us!', but with her I
don't think that's the case.
'(Could this be about... 'that thing'...?)'
'(It could be...)'
'The ones who started the current Soaring Club\nwere Isuka and Amane. At the time, it was only\nthe two of them.'
'They were able to do the club's activities by\nthemselves?'
'Back then, the student council were really\neasygoing. Especially towards Amane.'
'At any rate, she was the greatest genius to\nattend the school since its founding. The\nteachers turned a blind eye to most things.'
'Slurp... Oh, is that so?'
As Amane slurps her soup, she speaks like she's\ntalking about someone else again.
'I'm not a genius. Isuka always used to call me\nan idiot.'
'I can't believe she'd say something like that\nabout Amane...'
'Was Isuka really that amazing?'
'Yeah. Isuka was a genius.'
When Amane answers, she speaks proudly of her, as\nif she were her own.
A genius that surpasses Amane Mochizuki...
Hmm... I can't imagine it.
Looking over towards An-chan, he shrugs his\nshoulders and smiles.
'It's true that Isuka found the garage and the\nglider resting inside.'
'...(Gulp, gulp)'
Amane nods while busily biting into her chicken.
'Munch, munch... One day, out of the blue, she\nsaid 'I've found something incredible!''
'And then... Munch, munch... We decided to fly\nthe glider.'

A lot of the details were left out, but I
understood it for the most part. I decided to not
delve any deeper. This kind of thing happens
often when talking to Amane.
'The glider that you guys have been flying was\nbuilt by the old members. Amane and the others\nonly made some changes to it.'
'I always thought that Amane and the other\nmembers made the whole thing themselves.'
'The old members were really great too, weren't\nthey...?'
Hearing about the achievements of club members\nfrom days gone by, made our own achievements seem\nquite insignificant.
We've gotta work harder.
While we talk about the history of the Soaring\nClub, the ones who don't have much to do with it\nwere just enjoying the food.
'Ma-kun, these are delicious. The ones wrapped in\nbacon.'
'Which ones...? Wow, these are seriously tasty!'
'This type of food is great. At my place, we just\neat ramen and gyoza all the time.'
'Our dad hates western food, so I haven't really\neaten much of this kind of thing before.'
'Feel free to have seconds. There's still lots\nleft.'
'O...OK. ... Kotori's sister is really kind,\nisn't she?'
'She's also a total babe! Aoi's really got it\nmade, huh?'
'Can I have seconds?'
'Sure, coming right up!'
'It's OK, I'll do it.'
'Don't worry, Aoi, just sit down for now.'
she said, as her slippers pattered as she went\ninto the kitchen.
'Hibari would definitely make a great wife, don't\nyou think?'
'Does she have a boyfriend. I wonder?'
'Hmph... There's no way I'd let her go off with\nsome guy I don't even know the first thing\nabout.'
'I will rigorously scrutinize anyone who tries to\ngo out with her!'
'It's really obvious that you have a sister\ncomplex.'
'N-No, I don't! I just think the world of my\nsister, that's all!'
That excuse is completely lame.
Well, it's good for sisters to get along.
'Is your sister about the same age as An-chan?'
'...Possibly.'
We all look at An-chan, then at Amane.
'So, that would make her about the same age as\nAmane?'
'OK, sorry to keep you waiting.'
Hibari puts a second helping of chicken on\nAmane's plate.
If Amane hadn't become the Super Repeat Student,\nand had just graduated normally, maybe she\nwould've ended up like her...
'(Nah, there's no way that could happen.)'
She would've swapped her school uniform for a\nwhite coat, and joined her dad, working in the\nlab.
Maybe her lifestyle wouldn't be that different to\nhow it is now.
'That reminds me... munch, munch.'
'Amane, you're always drawing. Are those designs\nor something?'
Kotori asked a simple question.
'Yeah, I was wondering about that too.'
That was something that was on my mind as well.
'It's a glider.'
'But haven't we already finished it?'
'Yeah.' says Kotori.
Amane wiped her mouth and stood up.
She leaves the dining hall, and comes back\nshortly after.
'You mean this?'
Amane lays out the aforementioned designs.
It's a glider but it's a different shape to our\none.
In relation to the body, the wings protrude from\nfurther forward.
'What's this? The shape is different.'
'There are other improvements... The shape of the\nbody is the same, but look at this.'
Ageha points out all the small differences one by\none.
There were a considerable number of these\nchanges.
'This is the aircraft that we actually should've\nmade.'
'Should've made?'
Amane nods.
'As Tatsuya said before, the current glider was\nmade by the previous members of the Soaring\nClub.'
'It's extremely well made but it wasn't honed\ndown to the finer details.'

'It was probably based on a famous glider design
from overseas. There are signs that it mimic such
a design with a lack of understanding of the
functions.'
'That's where I made some improvements.'
We all eagerly look at the designs.
Even when I find the differences, I've got no\nidea how this is any better.
'But the old members used this aircraft to fly\nabove the clouds, didn't they?'
They also took that photo.
In which case, the design specs must be good\nenough, right?
'According to flight logs from the time, they\nused a tow plane to fly then.'
It's a launch method using a tow plane, not a\nwinch, to pull the glider into the air, taking\noff together.
'So, it was taken up to a pretty high altitude to\nbegin with?'
Amane nods.

'However, we don't have a plane. We use a winch
tow rope. So, in order to fly even a little
higher. I fine-tuned the design down to the
smallest details.'
The result of which are these designs.
'But in the end, we couldn't make it, could\nwe...?'
Kotori's question is answered by An-chan.
'Changes have been made to the body and the main\nwings would need to be completely rebuilt.'
'To carry this out would've taken a lot of time\nand money.'
If they had been working on this from back then,\nAn-chan would've been at the center of the\nproduction.
'It's not that it can't be done, it was\ndifficult, that's all.'
'Also, the designs aren't complete yet.'
'I can't seem to get my ideas together. It's\nbecause I'm stupid.'
If Amane can't do it, it would be impossible for\nanyone else too.
Amane carelessly folded up the designs, put them\nto one side, and went back to eating.
'The soup's splashing on them! Hibari, move them\na little further away!'
'OK!'
Hibari moved the designs to a place where they\nwouldn't get dirty, while the rest of us\ncontinued the meal.
After the meal, we went out into the garden to\nplay with fireworks.
Since the farewell party was planned in a hurry,\nthere was a limit to what we'd be able to do,\nbut...
... I want to play with fireworks with Amane!
said Kotori, who isn't exactly our leader, but\nshe decided it there and then.
There were no objections. The rest of us also\nwanted to play with fireworks, with Amane.
'Ah ha ha ha, this is really fun!'
'The color changed! Hey, look at this, Amane!'
'Oh, you're right. That's cool, I wanna try it\ntoo!'
Amane is doing handheld fireworks with Kotori.
They both seem to find these fireworks unusual,\nand are enjoying themselves.
'Those are no good... I have to show you these,\nwhich are a running tradition for us.'
Ageha. getting fired up, is carrying\nfountain-type fireworks, one in each hand. They\nare normally placed on the ground.
If you light them, then wave your arms around,\nyou can chase after people, which is one of\nour...
'Don't do it.'
'Why not? Hey, give those back!'
'We've finally created a peaceful atmosphere, and\nyou're gonna mess it up.'
'Tsk. You're no fun, Aoi.'
'Ageha, I don't like that anymore, stop acting\nlike a kid.'
This is what an older sister being scolded by her\nyounger sister looks like.
'Here we go, c'mon!'
shouted Masatsugu, as he came running in from the\nside. He was lighting large numbers of mini\npinwheels, and throwing them all over the place.
'Whoa!'
'Waah!'
'Hmm? Whoa!!'
'Eeeek!'
'Heheheh! How do you like that!?'
'Ma-bou, you idiot!'
'You dumbass, what're you gonna do if someone\ngets burned?'
'Oh, that was scary...'
'Grrr! He won't get away with this! Grab that\nmoron!'
'Heh heh! Come and get me!'
'Argh! He ran away!'
'Hold it right there!'
'You'll never catch me!'
'Whoooooah!!'
Masatsugu, running around like a little monkey,\nsuddenly stopped in his tracks.
In the blink of an eye, An-chan had grabbed him\nby the scruff of the neck.
'Ma-bou, can I have a word with you, over there?'
Speaking kindly, An-chan took Masatsugu over to\nthe shadows.
'Listen, Ma-bou. It's important to have fun, but\nyou shouldn't piss the girls off, OK?'
'You're not a kid anymore. You don't want the\ngirls to hate you, do you?'
'OK, OK... I'm sorry.'
'Oh, looks like he's annoyed An-chan.'
'He was doing the same thing you were planning to\ndo, wasn't he?'
'Everyone is so childish...'
'Hey everyone, the shaved ice is ready!'
Kanako came carrying a tray into the garden.
'Here you go, we've got syrup too.'
'Yay, shaved ice! Do you have condensed milk\nsyrup?'
'I want strawberry!'
'Alright, don't push. There's enough for\neveryone.'
'Thanks for going to all this trouble.'
'No, it's no problem. Kotori's having so much\nfun, after all.'
Hibari gets a little tearful.
I guess that since I came to the dormitory, the\nonly real thing she's enjoyed was eating ice\ncream.
At some point, the days where Kotori doesn't\nsmile have become fewer, and she has fun every\nday.
Not just Kotori, but the rest of us too.
'It's all thanks to your club activities.'
'Yeah, maybe.'
There was something that brought us all together\n-- something that would make us all feel the\nsame.
Amane and Isuka started it, and then myself and\nthe others will continue with it.
But Amane won't be around for much longer.
'Oh, shaved ice, huh? I might have lemon flavor.'
'An-chan... can I have some too?'
'Have you thought about what you've done?'
'Yes, I have! I don't want the girls to hate me!'
'Is that what you call 'thinking about what\nyou've done'?'
'Shut up. I don't accept you as a girl anyway.'
'What did you say!?'
'Geez, you guys are so noisy. Can't you just eat\nquietly... Aaah!'
'B-... Brain freeze...!'
'Yum, yum... It's cold and tasty. This strange\nblue color stimulates my appetite!'
Fireworks and shaved ice.
As one of the memories of summer, nothing beats\nthis.
After eating the shaved ice, there were still\nsome fireworks left.
It looks like Ageha got Hotaru and Masatsugu to\nbuy them, but it's kind of a problem because they\ndon't know how much is too much.
I head over to where Kotori are Ageha are, to\nplay with more fireworks.
'It's so pretty...'
'I prefer the big, spectacular ones though.'
I like them both but rather than getting really\nnoisy and excited about it, I wanted to make the\nmost of the last remnants of the summer.
As I light the handheld firework, An-chan comes\nup beside me.
'You wanna do one, An-chan? How about this\ngun-type one?'
'Hey, that's mine! I thought I'd save that for\nlast!'
'Nah, I'm OK. It's enough for me just to see you\nguys enjoying yourselves.'
Everyone looked at him like they didn't really\nunderstand what he meant.
An-chan sat down next to me, and looked over at\nAmane, who was also doing fireworks a little\nfurther away.
Amane was doing sparklers with Masatsugu and\nHotaru.
'Ha ha ha, these fireworks are so cute.'
'You're doing the sparklers last?'
'It's OK. I like these.'
'Yeah, me too.'
'Tsk. Girls like these kind of things, don't\nthey?'
An-chan, watching over them, had a kind yet sad\nlook in his eyes.
'Hey, An-chan.'
'Hmm?'
'Where did Isuka go?'
As I ask, Kotori and Ageha raise their heads.
'Why do you ask that?'
An-chan must realize that it's been on our minds.
But, despite that, that's how he answered.
'Amane told us... that she went away somewhere.'
...Well, I don't know. I don't know where she\nwent.
That's what Amane said earlier today when I asked\nher at Windmill Hill.
'Amane continued to build the glider because she\nwanted to know why Isuka was so obsessed with\nit.'
'She might understand it if she passes through\nthe passage of clouds... is what she said.'
'Hey, An-chan. Why did Isuka go away?'
I, or rather, all of us, had predicted the same\nanswer.
...That she had died in an accident.
It was a terrible thing to think, and we didn't\nwant to be right about it.
'...I don't know.'
'You don't know?'
'There was an accident, wasn't there...?'
An-chan's face seemed to say 'How do you know\nabout that?'.
'Yeah, it's true. It seems that Isuka was\ninvolved in that accident.'
'Then, she must've...'
In response to Kotori's murmuring, An-chan lowers\nhis head, like he can't say anything.
'It happened during a summer holiday. Amane and I\nweren't in Kazegaura at the time.'
'It was obvious that there had been an accident\nwhen we saw the wrecked glider.'
'But we were never told what actually happened,\nand Isuka never came back again.'
So she really did die after all...?
However, it seems that An-chan has another\nexplanation.
'If Isuka really had died, it would've become a\nmuch bigger problem than it did.'
'But the school covered up the incident, and it\nwas like nothing ever happened. Since then, it's\nbeen taboo to talk about it.'
'Didn't you look for her...?'
'We did. But Isuka was a boarding student who\nlived alone. No one knew where her family lived.'
'The owner of Flying Fish Manor would know.'
'She wouldn't tell us. It seems that she had been\ntold not to say anything.'
'Then Amane also...'
'Yeah, she's the same as me, she most likely\ndoesn't know where she is either.'
'Amane continued building the glider after Isuka\ndisappeared.'
'It's almost as if she believed that if she\ncarried on, Isuka would come back.'
'Did you carry on too, An-chan?'
An-chan shook his head.
That meant he was saying 'no'.
'After Isuka disappeared, Amane changed. She\nstarted avoiding people.'
'Amane did...?'
We looked at each other like we couldn't believe\nit.
'Since then, Amane and I have hardly seen each\nother. I've been concerned about it, though...'
'She's been so immersed in it, all alone in that\nempty garage, and it hurts to see her like that.'
'On top of that, I was also at a total loss as to\nwhat to do after Isuka suddenly disappeared.'
I didn't know what to say.
Amane, continuing to work on the glider, all\nalone, in that great big garage.
An-chan, hurt deeply from losing someone.
I didn't want to imagine either of them like\nthat.
'...When we met Amane, she quickly accepted us.'
'But, when it came to getting new members, she\nwasn't proactive about it at all.'
The thing that made her become more positive was\nKotori bringing the photo and Isuka's flight log.
'Time heals all wounds. Amane's stubbornness has\nstarted to melt away, hasn't it? But...'
'I think you guys are the reason why she is\nenjoying herself like this.'
'It changed color again. Ha ha, this is fun!'
'It's pretty, isn't it?'
An innocent smile lit up Amane's face as she\nwatched the little sparks crackling and popping.
The rainbow-colored lights reflected in her eyes\nas she watched earnestly, like a little kid.
Amane found little mysteries in each of the\nlittle sparks, and her curiosity made her heart\nflutter.
'Hey, let's compete to see who can make theirs\nthe longest.'
'Yeah, OK.'
'Sure, that sounds fun. Let's do that!'
An-chan watched over her with a kind look in his\neyes, but it was like he was looking at something\nfar, far, away.
'I was so busy taking care of myself, that I\ndidn't do anything for her, my friend.'
'...I know this might seem selfish, but I thank\nyou guys from the bottom of my heart for meeting\nher.'
'An-chan... we'll continue to be with her.'
An-chan shook his head.
'I've already retired from the club. As an old\nmember, if there's anything I can do to help,\nI'll do it.'
'Please take care of Amane until she leaves.'
Ageha, Kotori and I all nod silently at An-chan's\nrequest.
An-chan's cell phone starts ringing.
'Scuse me...'
'Hello, this is Tatsuya. Yes... yes... really,\nYoshizawa-san!?'
'OK, I understand, I'll come and get it first\nthing in the morning.'
An-chan grins as he ends the call.
'What is it?'
'You guys will be happy...!'
When he told us, we suddenly became about twice\nas excited.
Then...
'Amane!!'
'Tomorrow, the winch is...'
'The winch is coming back!!'
As we tell her, Amane tilts her head and looks at\nus dubiously.
'Umm... So, in other words...'
'We can start testing again from tomorrow!'
We forgot all 'the last remnants of summer'.
We were already thinking about the next day.
